poem:
### Modern Voices

In Manchester's alleys,
echoes of typewriters
silenced by screens.
No ink stains here,
just pixel pulse,
the new refrain
of a cyber town crier
bearing news
not on the wind,
but through aether—
truths whispered
in inboxes,
our stories told
by figures unseen.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
